content.body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/21550 … what’s the `Response.json()` method useful for?
content.formatted_body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/21550 … what’s the Response.json() method useful for?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/21550 … what’s the `Response.json()` method useful for?
Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/21550 … what’s the Response.json() method useful for?

content.body: it was added because it was useful for server-side runtimes that had fetch-based HTTP server APIs
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it was added because it was useful for server-side runtimes that had fetch-based HTTP server APIs

content.body: and it wasn't a burden on browsers
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: and it wasn't a burden on browsers

content.body: It's also useful in service workers
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It's also useful in service workers

content.body: OK. Well, it would be nice to have it documented in MDN — minimally at least with a one- or two-sentence description
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: OK. Well, it would be nice to have it documented in MDN — minimally at least with a one- or two-sentence description

content.body: it creates a response corresponding to the JSON serialization of the passed object

content.body: Andreu Botella: speaking of patches, I don’t know if you’ve had a chance to look at https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/pull/7886, but I’m wondering if there’s any reason you’re aware of that we can’t/shouldn’t use symlinks instead of redirects

content.body: There's no technical reason why not to use that, but I would prefer redirecting.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: There's no technical reason why not to use that, but I would prefer redirecting.

content.body:
> <@sideshowbarker:matrix.org> From a user point of view, it seems like redirecting is subobtimal

in the sense that if you're copying the URL in the address bar, it'd be the URL for a specific level?

in the sense that if you're copying the URL in the address bar, it'd be the URL for a specific level?

content.body: I wonder whether most users would see that as preferable

content.body: Also, at MDN we have a policy of linking to the un-leveled shortnames
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Also, at MDN we have a policy of linking to the un-leveled shortnames

content.body: we never link to the specific levels except in case of features that are on some higher leveled version but not in the current-work version

content.body:
> <@sideshowbarker:matrix.org> OK. Well, it would be nice to have it documented in MDN — minimally at least with a one- or two-sentence description

IIRC this was impossible in MDN because they use the same namespace "Response/json" for both static and prototype methods.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @sideshowbarker:matrix.org
OK. Well, it would be nice to have it documented in MDN — minimally at least with a one- or two-sentence description
IIRC this was impossible in MDN because they use the same namespace "Response/json" for both static and prototype methods.
